intro: Ranunculus erectus, commonly known as the upright buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and Asia. It features showy, yellow flowers with five to ten sepals that resemble petals, and it typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant has palmately divided leaves with three to five leaflets, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along streambanks. Ranunculus erectus is part of the Ranunculaceae family, known for its diverse and often showy flowers.
